author: jon kaufthal
text: ever sat at someone else's pc and wished you could open your address book? wish no more. planetall.com makes accessing your names, numbers, and schedule as simple as surfing the web. once you've registered, planetall.com gets to work. the site claims more than 100,000 groups, organized around real-world counterparts such as academic institutions and employers. tell it where you went to school and you'll get a list of your classmates who're also signed on to the service. request a link to an old drinking buddy and, pending his approval, each of you can access the other's contacts.not bad, but what about the nonmembers in your address book? just download puma's free intellisync software and everything you've got in outlook or on your pilot syncs to the password-protected web site.having a schedule on the web is nice, but planetall.com goes a step further: you can enter your travel plans and have the site notify you when you'll be crossing paths with a contact. planetall.com's 1.5 million members are a testament to its convenience. and the price couldn't be more right.planetall.com: free. planetall.com: street credjoystick to the cosmosmacsimum overdrivecritical massvid kid with big-screen aspirationsthe web's executive assistantfeed your headsatellites can waitkidcammusicjust outta betareadmethe name gamehands-free home accessout of africamutant killing spreelarger than lifecontributors
